definition: president (title of the head of state of China and several other nations)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
Xi Jinping (1953-), PRC politician, General Secretary of the CCP from 2012, president of the PRC from 2013
Hu Jintao (1942-), General Secretary of the CCP 2002-2012, president of the PRC 2003-2013
Jiang Zemin (1926-), politician, president of PRC 1993-2003
Liu Yunshan (1947-), PRC politician, background in journalism in Inner Mongolia, head of the Central Propaganda Department 2002-2012
the Great Hall of the People in Beijing
Hua Guofeng (1921-2008), leader of Chinese Communist Party after the Cultural Revolution
(Chinese) National People's Congress/abbr. to 人大[Ren2 da4]
pinyin: Quan2 guo2 Ren2 min2 Dai4 biao3 Da4 hui4
